answer: Arnold Schwarzenegger is an Austrian-born American actor, producer, activist, businessman, investor, writer, philanthropist, former professional bodybuilder, and politician\.

query: When did Arnold Schwarzenegger serve as Governor of California?
answer: Schwarzenegger served two terms as the 38th Governor of California from 2003 until 2011\.
optimal_answer: (Schwarzenegger was then re-elected on November 7 , 2006)|(from 2003 until 2011)

query: When did Arnold win Mr. Universe?
answer: He won the Mr\. Universe title at age 20 and went on to win the Mr\. Olympia contest seven times\.
Schwarzenegger's breakthrough film was the sword-and-sorcery epic Conan the Barbarian in 1982, which was a box-office hit and resulted in a sequel\.

query: What did Arnold Schwarzenegger appear in that was a massive critical and box-office success?
answer: In 1984, Schwarzenegger appeared in James Cameron's science-fiction thriller film The Terminator, which was a massive critical and box-office success\.

query: When did Schwarzenegger appear in The Terminator?
answer: In 1984, Schwarzenegger appeared in James Cameron's science-fiction thriller film The Terminator, which was a massive critical and box-office success\.

query: What successful films did Arnold Schwarzenegger appear in?
answer: Arnold Schwarzenegger appeared in a number of successful films, such as Commando \(1985\), The Running Man \(1987\), Predator \(1987\), Twins \(1988\), Total Recall \(1990\), Kindergarten Cop \(1990\) and True Lies \(1994\)\.
optimal_answer: Commando|The Running Man|Predator|Twins|Total Recall|Kindergarten Cop|True Lies

answer: Arnold was nicknamed the \"Austrian Oak\" and the \"Styrian Oak\" in his bodybuilding days, \"Arnie\" during his acting career, and \"The Governator\" \(a portmanteau of \"Governor\" and \"The Terminator\" â€“ one of his best-known movie roles\) since the start of his political career\.

query: When was Schwarzenegger elected as Govenor?
answer: As a Republican, Schwarzenegger was first elected on October 7, 2003, in a special recall election to replace then-Governor Gray Davis\.

Schwarzenegger was then re-elected on November 7, 2006, in California's 2006 gubernatorial election, to serve a full term as governor, defeating Democrat Phil Angelides, who was California State Treasurer at the time\.
